name: Bo Luo
content: Bo Luo - Homepage Bo Luo H.J. and Joan O. Wertz Professor Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science Director, High Assurance and Secure Systems (HASS) Research Center Institute for Information Sciences (I2S) The University of Kansas Home Research Publications Teaching Research Group Contact info Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS) 2016 Eaton Hall, 1520 West 15th St, Lawrence KS, 66045 Institute for Information Sciences (I2S) 341 Nichols Hall, 2335 Irving Hill Road, Lawrence, KS 66045 phone: 785-864-7749; email: bluo <at> ku <dot> edu My PGP public key My not-so-updated vita Research My current research interests lie in the intersection of security and privacy and AI/ML. In particular, I (together with my students and collaborators) mostly focus on two topics (in the past 5 years or so): Trustworthy and privacy-preserving machine learning: CCS'24a (benchmarking and detection of ChatGPT-generated text), CCS'24b (a physical-world attack against face recognition systems), ESORICS'24a (benchmarking and detection of AI-generated images), PETS'24 (secure multi-party computing for DNNs), CCS'22a (a feature-domain neural Trojan), ESORICS'22a (benchmarking the stealthiness of DL attacks), ACSAC'21 (universal defense against DNN adversarial example attacks), ESORICS'21 (defense against poisoning attacks in federated learning) IoT/CPS/Mobile security and privacy: ACSAC'25 (IoT privacy leakage detection), CCS'25 (detection and defense against IoT hidden attribute attack), PETS'25 (IoT cross-app privacy leak detection), ACSAC'24 (privacy policy compliance for Alexa skills), ESORICS'24b (security assessment of automative companion apps), ICPC'24 (mask app detection in iOS), ESORICS'22b (privacy compliance in IoT apps), ESORICS'20 (defense against CAN-bus denial and spoofing attacks), USENIX Sec'20 (IoT device identification in public WiFi) Before that, I also worked on social network analysis and user privacy protection, hardware-enabled security, information retrieval, database/XML access control, and privacy-preserving information sharing. We are looking for self-motivated students who are interested in academic research on information security. If you are interested in this opportunity or if you have questions, please drop me an email: bluo <at> ku <dot> edu. I will serve as the PC Co-Chair of SecureComm 2026. Submit your paper and join us in Lancaster, UK! I'm an associate editor of IEEE TDSC and ACM TIoT. I'm also on the program commitee of NDSS'26, USENIX Security'26, CCS'26, and PoPETS/PETS'26. I am the PI of Jayhawk SFS -- CyberCorps: Scholarship for Service program at KU. For more information about the program, please visit Jayhawk SFS program homepage. I am the director of the High Assurance and Secure Systems (HASS) Research Center at I2S. I2S is a National Center of Academic Excellence in Cyber Defense (CAE/CD) and Research (CAE-R) designated by the National Security Agency and Department of Homeland Security. Awards Distinguished Paper Award, IEEE/ACM International Conference on Program Comprehension (ICPC), 2024 KU EECS Excellence in Undergraduate Teaching Professorship, 2023 Best paper honorable mention, ACM Conference on Computer and Communications Security (CCS), 2022 Best paper award, Annual Computer Security Applications Conference (ACSAC), 2021 Miller Scholar, University of Kansas, 2016, 2017, 2021 Best paper award, Annual Computer Security Applications Conference (ACSAC), 2017 Miller Professional Development Award for Distinguished Service, University of Kansas, 2015 Education The Pennsylvania State University, University Park, Pennsylvania Ph.D., Information Sciences and Technology, August, 2008.      Advisor: Dr. Dongwon Lee The Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shatin, N.T.
